comments.text:
1. Open a Google Doc (I was using a spread sheet)
2. Modify a cell and immediately click on another tab

Expected results:
* I get switch to the other tab (regardless of what network operation the previous tab is doing)

Actual results:
* Nothing happens until Google Docs saves the change and then and only then the browser is responsive again and switches to the other tab (the click that I did few seconds ago).

This is quite noticeable (several seconds) and very dependent on Google Docs' responsiveness. If it starts happening it is extremely bad.

Build identifier: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 6.1; Win64; x64; rv:10.0a1) Gecko/20111022 Firefox/10.0a1
